Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 15th overall pick, by Minnesota in 1968...
Had first career hit on 4/9/1971, off Curtis Sparks (WIS)...
Hit first career homerun on 5/15/1971, off John Levan (CBC)...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Third Base in 1973...
Had 20-game hitting streak snapped on 4/7/1974...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Shortstop in 1975...
Won World Championship with Minnesota in 1979...
Signed as a free agent by Penn on 2/13/1980 to a 2-year deal worth $3,000,000 per year...
Had 5 hits with 3 RBI against Capital City on 4/13/1981...
Signed as a free agent by Penn on 2/4/1982 to a 2-year deal worth $700,000 per year...
